alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 4:33AM EDT until September 10 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding is expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 6 PM EDT this evening. Peak water levels are expected around the time of high tide, which will be around 4 pm ET this afternoon. For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Peak water levels of 1.5 ft to 2.5 ft above ground level are expected around the time of high tide. At these levels boat ramps are flooded, along with docks along the water front. Minor overwash is expected along Alligator Point Road. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
